description:
Collaborate with your team

Whether your teams are co-located, distributed, or remote with Whiteboard Team you, will experience real-time teamwork on an online whiteboard.

Get visual feedback

Increase productivity and efficiency by collaborating on a real-time online whiteboard. Whiteboard Team enables you to collaborate and communicate better.

Visualize and explain your ideas

Whiteboard Team provides an infinite zoom-able canvas with basic shapes and sticky notes to help you visually express and share your thoughts.
name: Whiteboard
plugin_instructions:
- - - - - SETUP & TUTORIAL - - - - -

Step 1) Create an account : https://www.whiteboard.team/

Step 2) Head over to the <developers> section of the Dashboard, and click create an app. You will be prompted to choose a name for your app.

Step 3) Write down your Client ID & Client Secret. Do not share your these with anyone.

Step 4) Enter your Client ID in the appropriate boxes under the "plugins" section of your bubble app.

Your whiteboard is now ready for use. Simply find the whiteboard element inside the bubble editor and draw a shape. Then it give it a board code inside the appropriate field. Board codes must be at least 15 characters long and they should be unique.

Tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGkSD0IlAcw


- - - - - ROLES - - - - -


If you would like to restrict access to whiteboard functionality for groups of users, you must define roles. There are three roles: viewer, editor and facilitator.

Viewer: May only view a board

Editor: Can view and edit a board

Facilitator: Can view, edit and clear a board

By default, a person visiting your page (logged-in or not) will be assigned as an editor. However, if you would like for a certain group of users to only be able to view a board, you must provide a list of their emails in the "viewers" field of the element.

For example, "Viewers" : "Do a Search For Users: each item's emails"

Assigning roles are optional. But be careful, once a role has been defined (for either viewer, editor or facilitator) then the default role now becomes viewer. 

In other words, if you define a role for facilitator you must make sure that you also define viewers and editors. In the case where there are roles assigned, and the current user's role is not defined, then the role will default to viewer.

An important thing to take note is that if a user is given more than one role, then the role with the most privileges will take priority.

For example, if user1 is given roles viewer and editor, then the user1 will be an editor. Also, if user2 is given roles editor and facilitator, then user2 is a facilitator.


- - - - - SUPPORT - - - - -

For more questions feel free to leave a comment here: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGkSD0IlAcw

Or visit the GitHub repository and figure it out yourself:

https://github.com/deleseleuc-jonah/Bubble-Plugin-Whiteboard


- - - - - READ THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS - - - - -

https://www.whiteboard.team/info/developer-terms
